header: Choosing colors for a new project can be daunting. We made it easy.

layout.title: A New Way to Fuel Growth
text: Sometimes distribution channels that you used to depend on no longer work and you need to find new ways to find customers. This is how Color Supply came about. Color Supply was an engineering-as-marketing initiative designed to capture email leads.

layout.title: Design for Impact
text: In general we like to design fast and get user feedback. But for this project, we had to do some research first to make sure we made something users would immediately love. Our research indicated we should focus on three key parts:
From our research, we decided the product should focus on three key parts:

layout.title: Ready-to-Use Color Palettes
text: These pre-made color palettes give users a head start when choosing colors. They can pick multiple color combos, save them, and tweak them later.

layout.title: Color Wheels
text: There are ten color wheels to guide users when picking colors. Each wheel has a theme with the default being used to demonstrate color theory.

layout.title: Color Preview
text: When you click a palette, the shapes and icons change to those colors. This helps you picture what the colors would look like in your project.
All these features make choosing colors much quicker.

layout.title: Results
text: We're now Color Supply's one-stop design partner and continue to improve their tool. The site is a big hit and has gathered tens of thousands of emails. It often goes viral on Twitter and is most popular in Japan.
